info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued December 15 at 3:23PM CST until December 15 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Very windy, warm, and dry conditions expected until early evening... .An upper level storm system over the Central Plains today, will continue to bring strong southwest winds with it until after sunset. The strongest gusts will briefly exceed 70 mph across far northwestern Oklahoma. Well above average temperatures and minimum relative humidity in the low teens will also be present, resulting in Critical to Extreme fire weather conditions. These conditions will improve rapidly after sunset. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AND WARM TEMPERATURES FOR MOST OF WESTERN OKLAHOMA AND HARDEMAN COUNTY TEXAS... * TIMING...Late morning through early evening. * WINDS...Southwest 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 70 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 15 percent. * TEMPERATURES...Mid 70s to lower 80s. * IMPACTS...Any fires that start in this environment will become extremely difficult to control.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures will contribute to extreme fire behavior.
